Instructor Recruitment Timeline




Applications open: [Date]
Application deadline: [Date]
Training begins: [Date]

title: Apply as an Instructor
text:
Instructor Requirements
Essential qualifications:

Expert-level knowledge in specific R/open science topics
Teaching or training experience
Strong communication skills
Availability for workshop preparation and delivery

title: Apply as an Instructor
text:
Teaching Topics
We’re seeking instructors for:

R Package Development
Testing and Continuous Integration
Documentation Best Practices
Code Review
Open Science Practices
Data Management
Reproducible Research

title: Apply as an Instructor
Apply as an Instructor
text:
Selection Process

Application Review
Teaching Sample Review
Mock Teaching Session
Final Selection and Onboarding

title: Apply as an Instructor
text:
Questions?
For questions about teaching or the application process:

Review our FAQ section
Contact the training coordinator at [email]

title: Apply as a Mentor
text:
Mentor Recruitment Timeline




Applications open: [Date]
Application deadline: [Date]
Mentorship begins: [Date]

title: Apply as a Mentor
text:
Mentor Requirements
Essential qualifications:

Significant experience in R package development
Active participation in the R/open source community
Experience in code review and technical documentation
Time availability of 2-3 hours per week for 6 months

title: Apply as a Mentor
text:
Mentor Responsibilities
As a mentor, you will:

Guide 1-2 Champions through their project development
Provide regular code review and feedback
Attend monthly mentor coordination meetings
Support Champions in community engagement
Review technical documentation

title: Apply as a Mentor
Apply as a Mentor
text:
Selection Process

Application Review
Experience Verification
Interview with Program Coordinators
Final Selection and Onboarding

title: Apply as a Mentor
text:
Questions?
For questions about mentoring or the application process:

Review our FAQ section
Contact the mentor coordinator at [email]

title: Apply as a Champion
text:
Application Timeline




Applications open: [Date]
Application deadline: [Date]
Program start: [Date]

title: Apply as a Champion
text:
Application Timeline




Applications open: [Date]
Application deadline: [Date]
Program start: [Date]

title: Apply as a Champion
text:
Requirements
Before applying, please ensure you meet the following requirements:

Intermediate R programming skills
Basic understanding of version control (Git)
Interest in open science and reproducible research
Commitment to attend weekly sessions and complete assignments
Time availability of 5-7 hours per week for 6 months

title: Apply as a Champion
text:
What We’re Looking For
Ideal candidates will demonstrate:

Motivation to contribute to open source scientific software
Interest in community engagement and peer learning
Commitment to open science principles
Willingness to learn and share knowledge

title: Apply as a Champion
Apply as a Champion
text:
Selection Process

Application Review (2-3 weeks)
Initial Screening
Short Interview with Program Team
Final Selection

title: Apply as a Champion
text:
Questions?
If you have any questions about the application process, please:

Check our FAQ section
Contact us at [program email]

title: Visión general del Programa
text:
If there are people that use and teach R, there are several initiatives working on “making” R multilingual:

Multilingual books and websites: https://ropensci.org/multilingual-publishing/
Multilingual help: https://ropensci.org/blog/2024/07/09/multilingual-documentation-wg/
Multilingual error messages: https://developer.r-project.org/TranslationTeams.html
Multilingual functions and packages: https://ropensci.org/events/r-en-rosario-champions/
